alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Yalobusha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 8:25PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Yalobusha and west central Calhoun Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 824 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coffeeville, or 14 miles south of Water Valley, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Water Valley, Coffeeville, Velma, Scobey, Spearman, Bryant, Benwood, Tyson, Gums, Retreat, Pine Valley and Tillatoba. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi.
